Nightstrike:

Nightstrike frowned, he felt annoy with that bot (Squawtalk)

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Soulstice Omega" <thecode@p...> wrote:
> Squawktalk: Uh, uh! Megatron tell Squawktlak to give tour to new 
bot!...
> 
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "rAuq" <rauq@t...>
> To: <nbwrpg@y...>
> Sent: Saturday, April 28, 2001 12:17 AM
> Subject: Re: Cepta, meet Squawktalk...
> 
> 
> > ---Switchblade---
> >
> > Switchblade enters the main room followed by Nightstrike. He sees
> > Squawktalk and half frowns, "Squawktalk, get out of the way, I've
> > got important business to attend to." He motions for Nightstrike 
to
> > follow. Then he sees Cepta for the first time. "Hmmm, new parts,
> > who're you?" his eyes narrow and flash green then return to normal
> >
> >
> >
> > On 27 Apr 2001, at 21:58, Soulstice Omega wrote:
> >
> > > Squawktalk, listening to Megatron, flies to Cepta.
> > >
> > > Squawktalk: Hello, hello, you want the tour, right? Of course 
you do!
> Okay! Anyway, first of all, this is the main chamber, it serves 
well because
> it's main. It's where you are when you first walk in, it's where 
you are
> when you see the door! It's where we go sometime to leave the base, 
it's
> > also where we go after we come in! It's got all these cool 
computers and
> stuff, and tables and that and it's where we are right now! Isn't 
that a
> coincidence? Well, anyway, it's a nice room maybe a little too 
dusty but
> then again maybe not and it's a good room because it has lots of 
room, and
> it
> > leads into all of the other rooms, it's also one of the biggest 
rooms,
> which is good, because everyone might try to come in at the same 
time, and
> if they do and the room is really tiny then everyone will be 
crowded and the
> base might explode. Also, it's big because something might happen 
like
> > someone breaks in, and there might be a shootout and everyone 
will get
> shot if there isn't much room, did I mention that? I don't think I 
did,
> correct me if I'm wrong, but I know I'm not wrong because I'm 
right. Anyway,
> I'm Squawktalk and you are? I mean what's your name, I'm not 
calling you
> > Squawktalk, that would be silly, wouldn't it? I hope you have a 
nice name,
> you probably do, but I still hope, because hoping can get you stuff
> sometimes, and anyway, it's fun, so about your name, it should be 
nice
> because my name is cool and I met you, didn't I? Anyhow, what I was 
trying
> to say
> > is that maybe we've spent too long in this room, want to go to 
the next
> room? It would be good because then we won't be in this room and 
we'll be in
> the next one instead and I can talk to you in there just hurry up 
and don't
> take forever, okay?...
> > >
> >
> >

> >
